title: Voting guide: Here’s what voters need to know before Boston’s Tuesday election
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston polls will operate from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. at 275 precincts for Tuesday's election.
Mayor Michelle Wu is running unopposed, while Boston City Council seats are contested, including four at-large positions.
32,737 of 51,769 mail-in ballots have been returned; ballots must be submitted by 8 p.m. at drop boxes or City Hall.

title: The Bruins’ second line is looking like a difference-maker, in more ways than one
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Casey Mittelstadt boosts Boston Bruins' second line, contributing six points in seven games post-benching.
Bruins' second line, featuring Mittelstadt, Zacha, and Arvidsson, outscored opponents 4-2 over 66 minutes.
Coach Marco Sturm's strategy includes benching players to improve performance, as seen with Mason Lohrei's situation.

title: Garrett Crochet, Roman Anthony named finalist for Cy Young, Rookie of the Year Awards
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Garrett Crochet named a finalist for AL Cy Young Award, leading the league in innings pitched and strikeouts.
Crochet posted an 18-5 record with a 2.59 ERA, helping Boston in postseason against Yankees.
Roman Anthony is a finalist for AL Rookie of the Year, having batted .292 with eight home runs in 71 games.

title: Ranking top priorities for Patriots at NFL trade deadline
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots seek to enhance roster at NFL trade deadline, prioritizing edge rusher and running back positions.
New England considering linebacker, safety, and cornerback additions for depth ahead of the roster lock.
Wide receiver upgrades will be tough due to high asking prices for top talent like Olave and Waddle.

title: Patriots’ pass-protection issues are mounting as Drake Maye ties worrisome stat from last year
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The New England Patriots' offensive line struggles, giving up 34 sacks this season, the second-most in the NFL.
Drake Maye faced six sacks in Sunday's game, marking 12 sacks over the last two games.
Patriots' coaches emphasize improving protection for Maye, as he ties last season's sack total with four fewer games played.

title: Downtown Boston hotel settles discrimination complaint after woman was accused of being a man
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Liberty Hotel agreed to a settlement with the state after an incident involving discrimination against Ansley Baker.
The hotel will donate $10,000 to an LGBTQIA2S+ non-profit and update its nondiscrimination practices.
Baker plans to file a civil lawsuit seeking punitive damages, alleging repeated lies by the hotel.

title: Falcons coach walks back ‘clapgate’ accusations after Patriots push back
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Falcons coach Raheem Morris retracts accusations of Patriots mimicking the snap count after a 24-23 loss.
Morris initially claimed the Patriots simulated QB Michael Penix Jr.'s clap cadence, leading to penalties.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel dismisses the claims, attributing game noise to enthusiastic fans.

title: Alex Bregman opts out of Red Sox contract, will hit free agency
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Bregman opted out of his Red Sox contract, entering free agency with two years and $80 million remaining.
Bregman, 32, played 114 games in 2025, hitting .273 with 18 home runs and 62 RBIs despite a quad injury.
The Red Sox face competition from teams like the Tigers and Mariners to re-sign the veteran third baseman.

title: Patriots NFL trade deadline live updates: Will New England make moves before Tuesday?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots face decisions before Tuesday's NFL trade deadline to enhance their 7-2 team's depth.
Eliot Wolf and Patriots' management consider trades without sacrificing future assets, despite needing roster reinforcements.
Despite selling Kyle Dugger and Keion White, Patriots explore adding an edge rusher and trading Anfernee Jennings.

title: After an eventful week, Bruins’ Hampus Lindholm has ‘a lot to be thankful for’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hampus Lindholm returned to the Bruins lineup following a lower-body injury, contributing to their improved defense and 5-1-0 record.
Lindholm and his fiancée, Amanda, welcomed their first child, Magnolia, named after Amanda's favorite tree.
Coach Marco Sturm credits Lindholm's presence for stabilizing the team's defensive structure and enhancing their overall game.
